Hi, although it is very hard to narrow down on one movie, I guess mine would have to be the social network, a movie based on the life of Mark Zuckerberg. The reason why I choose this movie is because it’s different, and it’s real. The story is based on the true life of Facebook founder and CEO, and further shows his journey through facebook. However what makes this movie especially stand out is that it clearly highlights his flaws and failures at facebook, and further there is emphasis on showing the truth about how the ideas were found and what happened. Unlike other movies where everything is sugar coated, this movie clearly shows you how Mark got to where he is today, and I found that to be more interesting than anything else. I also found that it tells a story that is not a well known, and does an amazing job at doing it. Further the movie tries to draw a line between success and happiness in its own way, showing that when he was successful, he wasn’t as happy, a message that although was underlying, was portrayed very well. I hope this answer helped you.

I can whole-heartedly recommend The Princess Bride. It is an all-around entertaining movie, with action, romance, suspense and comedy. There is no gratuitous swearing (I think the only scene which could even be considered bawdy is “There is a shortage of perfect breasts in this country; it would be a pity to damage yours.”) A star-studded cast and memorable lines - this one can be watched repeatedly. I own it on VHS and DVD, and yet would still watch it on broadcast TV if it came on.

Like most other people who also answered the question, I could just list a bunch of movies that I love. I think it would be a movie that affects you personally. There is one that will forever change the way you think, and make you so grateful for your life situation. It’s this movie: The Pursuit of Happyness  If you think about a “must see”, I think this movie will change you the most. The other movies I listed are great, and probably better movies than this one, but this one is one I recommend everyone should see. It gives you a glimpse into poverty and helps you become grateful for your situation. Plus it has Will Smith.

Cube: a “horror” movies made in Canada, about a group of people who wake up, stuck in a cube. Nowhere near as good as the original, the higher budget actually working against it in this case. But it has the best damn movie title ever.

Although I have a list for must watch but if I were to take a name of one movie then it would be “The Departed” directed by Martin Scorsese , the star cast includes Leonardo Decaprio, Mark wahlberg, Matt Damon, Alec Baldwin, Jack Nicholson and Martin sheen. An undercover agent and an espionage agent try to counter-attack each other in order to save themselves from being exposed in front of the authorities. The level of realism shown by Martin Scorsese is commendable, and the meticulous and densely layered saga of betrayal revenge and espionage makes this movie a gem among gems

All The President’s Man  Just Imagine a scenario where two rookie journalist uncover a whole setup which leads to the resignation of president of the most powerful country (USA). Than it is not limited to your imagination ,this is an actual event happened in the US history , based on Nixon presidency Era. This brilliant movie take you through a wonderful journey about how real journalism work without any hi-fi spy work but only through sheer determination and the will to uncover the truth. It is a must watch movie to understand why free press is the most essential and sometime revolutionary part of a democracy. Happy Watching !!..

Cast Away Cast Away is a 2000 American survival drama film directed and co-produced by Robert Zemeckis and starring Tom Hanks, Helen Hunt, and Nick Searcy. The film depicts a FedEx employee marooned on an uninhabited island after his plane crashes in the South Pacific and his attempts to survive on the island using remnants of his plane's cargo.

Hello, For me, a “Good movie” has many forms. There are movies that are highly entertaining. There are movies that are very well written and well acted that has a moving plot. There are movies that are really mind blowing and intense. So it really depends on the type of movie that you want to watch. If you’re into intense combat/fighting scenes, I can suggest Ipman, The man from nowhere and The raid redemption. Those movies have breath taking fighting scenes. If you’re into crime/thriller/mystery with nice twist, you can check out L.A confidential, The departed, the usual suspect. If you’re into action comedy, I recommend Hotfuzz and In bruges. Here are some of my favorites that you might want to try too. Inglorious basters Kokuhaku Eternal Sunshine of spotless mind. Thank you! :)

Signs with Mel Gibson. Something exist on this planet that looks very much like the creature that is the alien in this movie. I saw one as a child back in the 1960’s. Although what I saw was not as muscular and did not have fangs or claws. It was not scary except the WTF? factor. I have searched the internet and found other people who have reported seeing something that is very similar to what I saw. There is something to all of this though I am not sure what. The creature I saw was on foot . No space craft at all. (except it looked over the top of our car into the night sky. Could have been looking for one? IDK). Something is being hidden from us. People really need to wake up. Have you heard about Missing 411? Look it up strange disappearances in national parks.

Citizen Kane. It’s literally the best movie of all time. When a reporter is assigned to decipher newspaper magnate Charles Foster Kane's (Orson Welles) dying words, his investigation gradually reveals the fascinating portrait of a complex man who rose from obscurity to staggering heights. Though Kane's friend and colleague Jedediah Leland (Joseph Cotten), and his mistress, Susan Alexander (Dorothy Comingore), shed fragments of light on Kane's life, the reporter fears he may never penetrate the mystery of the elusive man's final word, "Rosebud."

Cargo 200 (Russian: Груз 200, translit Gruz 200) is a Russian thriller film from 2007 by Aleksei Balabanov. “Cargo 200″ is a code word for casualties that occur during military operations in former Soviet Union. As someone who grew up in former Soviet Union, I urge everyone to watch that film, it will let you see a fraction of what the Communist regime bred and left as a dying monument.
